intro: Diaspananthus uniflorus, commonly known as the single-flower spirea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its slender, arching stems that bear clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along forest floors or in swampy areas. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly serrated edge. Diaspananthus uniflorus is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and ability to thrive in humid climates.
